alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 11:28PM CDT until August 04 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Illinois, including the following county, southeast Shelby. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated rain and thunderstorms continuing across the area, with accumulations of a half to 1 inch in the past hour from Shelbyville to Mode. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in this area since 5 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stewardson, Strasburg, Sigel, Trowbridge and Mode.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
